li.p: Click the Manual button on the bottom of the screen to display the Manual Operation menu.

ul.li: The Safety Override bar turns green when the controller is in use.

note.p: AP means anti-parallel mode. Diff means differential (free movement).

li.p: Click the Carriage button on the bottom of the screen to display the Carriage menu, which shows details about the carriage itself, but not the battery.

ul.li: The System Status on the upper left shows the status of the CVC controller, SICK controller, CAN bus, and WLAN.
There are also details about the AGV position and whether the AGV is stopped.
In the upper center of the screen, the driver status for travel and lift are displayed.

li.p: Click the Battery button on the bottom of the screen to display the main Battery menu, which shows the charge level and the status of the battery.

ul.li: Click the upper right arrow on the right side of the screen to display the Battery Status menu, shown to the right.
Click the lower right arrow to display the Charger Status General menu.
Click the left arrow to return to the main Battery menu.

li.p: There are three Charger Status screens. Navigate between these screens using the gray arrow next to the buttons.

ul.li: The General screen displays general charging information.
The Error/Warnings screen displays the status of any warnings.
The Electronics screen provides additional data.
Click the left arrow to return to the main Battery menu.

li.p: There are five Information Details screens. Navigate between these screens using the gray arrows next to the buttons.

ul.li: The first three screens provide various operational data. See the three screens on the right.

li.p: The fourth Details screen provides information about the four laser scanners/sensors.
The fifth Details screen provides E-Stop information.
Click the Maintenance button on the bottom of the screen to display the Main Maintenance screen.

ul.li: Navigate between the two screens using the gray arrows next to the buttons.

The Drives Control screen provides the following information:
1 = Sets the lift position to zero
2 = Lifts and lowers the lift without limits
3 = Sets the steer angle to zero
4 = Graphical and numerical lift position

li.p: An oil change must be performed on the lifting spindle drives after 500 operating hours.

ul.li: If this value is exceeded, an oil symbol will appear in the top section of every menu/screen.

li.p: Pop-up windows are displayed as an additional safety query to allow the lift, steering angles, or operating hours counter of the lift to be set to 0.
Click the User button on the bottom of the screen to display the Main User screen, where users and administrators can log in and out, and set the language and units.

note.p: Parameters can only be changed with the highest user level. Settings in the system area of the control panel are reserved for HEGLA service technicians or specially trained and instructed specialist personnel.

p.p: (See also the screen on the next page.)
